{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WNDR3700 |revision=v2 |asin=B002HWRJY4;GB;,B002HWRJY4;US; |est_release_date=12/2010 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Delta Networks |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY308300092 |ic_id=4054A-08300092 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR7161 |cpu1_cspeed=680 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12845EMI-10G |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5DS16M16CS-5T |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag=yes,, internal,, 14-pad header,, J3 |serial=yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, 3.3V TTL,, J1,, (115200,8,N,1) |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9220 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR9223 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Realtek |sw_model=RTL8366SR |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=DFS |stock_boot=U-Boot;1.1.4;; |tp_firmware=OpenWrt,DD-WRT,CeroWrt |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=A0:21:B7,C4:3D:C7,E0:46:9A |oui_eth=A0:21:B7,C4:3D:C7,E0:46:9A }} '''N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router'''
{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=WNDR3700v2|vs_id=17703}}
Simultaneous Dual-Band, Gigabit Ethernet
*[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wndr3700 On the OpenWrt wiki] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Netgear_WNDR3700 On the DD-WRT wiki] *[http://dev.debwrt.net/wiki/NetgearWNDR3700 On the DebWrt wiki]
*Note: :Estimated date of release is per [https://www.google.com/trends/explore#q=WNDR3700v2 Google Trends data]. :Default hardware for the [http://www.bufferbloat.net/projects/cerowrt CeroWrt] bufferbloat research project. :The AR7161 has a 32-bit MIPS 24K processor core. :The AR9220 is a 2.4GHz and 5GHz Dual-band radio, the AR9223 2.4GHz only.
*Version 2 changes the board layout, replacing the 5GHz onboard antennae with two ''Rayspan'' "meta-material" off board "patch" antennae. :''Rayspan'' was liquidated by its investors and the ''Rayspan'' patents were purchased by ''Tyco Electronics'' in Q1 2011. :FCC exhibits show ''Rayspan'' antennae in 2010 Oct 05 filings, but not in earlier and later WNDR3700v2 filings.
*[http://www.macronix.com/en-us/Product/Pages/ProductDetail.aspx?PartNo=MX25L12845E Macronix MX25L12845E] 128Mb "Duplex Series" Serial Flash *[http://www.macronix.com/Lists/DataSheet/Attachments/2497/MX25L12845E,%203V,%20128Mb,%20v1.9.pdf MX25L12845E] Serial Flash Specification
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31396-netgear-wndr3700v2-n600-wireless-dual-band-gigabit-router-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder''']
